text: What's the recommended way to build a large string across many calls? Given that Strings are immutable, I assume that standard concatenation using `*` will be inefficient.

elements.text: What's the recommended way to build a large string across many calls? Given that Strings are immutable, I assume that standard concatenation using

text: It depends a bit. If it's occuring in a single line x = a * b * c, that is done all in one. But if you're doing a loop or something, yeah it's inefficient.

elements.text: It depends a bit. If it's occuring in a single line x = a * b * c, that is done all in one. But if you're doing a loop or something, yeah it's inefficient.

text: I don't know if there's a preferred way, but there's a StringBuilders.jl package I found searching JuliaHub <https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages?q=string> <https://github.com/davidanthoff/StringBuilders.jl>

text: I suppose writing to an IOBuffer is how one would do it otherwise.

elements.text: I suppose writing to an IOBuffer is how one would do it otherwise.

text: `print` to an `IOBuffer` and then use `String(take!(buf))` once you are done writing to it
